p: In Gangelt (Germany), an event linked to carnival celebrations caused SARS-CoV-2 to spread throughout the city, resulting in 3% of the population with positive RT-PCR results. Serological screening revealed later that 16% of the population were exposed ( Streeck et al., 2020). Even in densely populated and severely affected areas, the prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibodies is still relatively low, e.g., 11% in Madrid, Spain ( Gobierno de Espa√±a MdCeI et al., 2020), 15% in London, UK ( England, 2020), and 20% in New York City, USA ( State of NY, 2020).
